title: BSF returns body of Bangladeshi youth through C’nawabganj border
body: The Indian Border Security Force has handed over the body of a Bangladeshi youth, recovered from the Indian territory along the Chapainawabganj border, to the Border Guard Bangladesh. The body of Tasir Ali, son of Ibrahim Haque of Bakher Ali, a resident of Paschimpara area under Chapainawabganj Sadar, was returned through a flag meeting between the BGB and the BSF at the Johorpur Tek border in Chapainawabganj on Friday night. Lieutenant Colonel Kazi Mustafizur Rahman, commander of the 53 BGB battalion, said that the flag meeting was held around 9:00pm on Friday after which the Indian police formally handed over the body to Bangladesh police. Inspector Sukomal Chandra Debnath, investigation officer of Chapainawabganj Sadar police station, received the body on behalf of Bangladesh police. He said that marks of pellet injuries were found on the right side of Tasir’s chest but it could not be confirmed who fired the shots. The body was handed over to the family later that night. Earlier on Wednesday, the Indian police recovered Tasir Ali’s body from the Bhagirathi River on the Indian side near Bakher Ali border under Chapainawabganj Sadar. According to family members, Tasir had gone missing after illegally crossing the border into India with several associates.
